statement: C. Bowlstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test64 megabytesinputinput.txtoutputoutput.txtOnce Petya was in such a good mood that he decided to help his mum with the washing-up. There werendirty bowls in the sink. From the geometrical point of view each bowl looks like a blunted cone. We can disregard the width of the walls and bottom. Petya puts the clean bowls one on another naturally, i. e. so that their vertical axes coincide (see the picture). You will be given the order in which Petya washes the bowls. Determine the height of the construction, i.e. the distance from the bottom of the lowest bowl to the top of the highest one.InputThe first input line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 3000). You are given a list of bowls, each described by its height ($h$), the radius of its bottom ($r$), and the radius of its top ($R$).  The bowls are stacked one on top of the other, with their vertical axes aligned.  

Determine the total height of the stack of bowls. 

The input will consist of:

* The number of bowls ($n$)
* For each bowl:
    * Height ($h$)
    * Bottom radius ($r$)
    * Top radius ($R$)

Output the total height of the stack of bowls, accurate to at least 6 decimal places.
You are given a list of bowls, each with a height, bottom radius, and top radius. The bowls are stacked one on top of the other with their centers aligned.  Find the total height of the stack.
